content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position (approx. 2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the production and material‐transfer network for copper cable manufacturing:
– Factory interface:
 • Input Chest at Position(2.5, 17.5)
 • Factory Burner Inserter at Position(3.5, 17.5) placed with direction RIGHT
 • An additional Burner Inserter at Position(2.5, 16.5)
 • A Burner Inserter loaded with coal at Position(1.5, 17.5)
– Assembly unit:
 • Assembling Machine–1 at Position(1.5, 19.5) set for copper‑cable production
– Belt depot (for receiving materials from extraction):
 • Wooden Chest at Position(3.5, 15.5) serving as an isolated belt depot
 • Transport Belt segment at Position(4.5, 15.5) adjacent to the depot
 • Depot Burner Inserter at Position(3.5, 14.5)
– Ancillary smelting/storage units (integrated into the network):
 • Stone Furnace producing iron‑plate at Position(–3.0, 19.0)
 • Stone Furnace producing copper‑plate at Position(–4.0, 21.0)
 • Storage Chests at Positions (–4.5, 18.5), (–5.5, 21.5) and (1.5, 21.5)
 • An extra Burner Inserter at Position(0.5, 21.5)

### Extraction System Interface at Position (–3.5, 27.5)
Provides the raw output feed into the belt network:
– Extraction System Burner Inserter at Position(–3.5, 27.5) with drop position Position(–3.5, 28.5)

### Electricity Generator at Position (–0.5, 24.5)
Supplies power through a fluid‐based system:
– Steam Engine (Generator) at Position(–0.5, 24.5)
– Boiler at Position(–5.5, 24.0)
– Offshore Pump at Position(–7.5, 25.5)

### Research Lab (electrical_id: 7106)
Designed for technology research:
– Laboratory with lab_input {automation‑science‑pack: 17} (status: NO_POWER; position not specified)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Target Issue
 – When connecting transport belts, ensure the target entity is an inserter rather than a steam engine. Repeated errors arose from attempting to attach belts directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine. Use an inserter that accepts items as the endpoint for belt connections.

• Placement Distance Error
 – Always move the player close to the target position before placing an entity. The “target position is too far” error indicates that the placement was attempted from a distance exceeding the allowed maximum.

• Inventory Availability Issue
 – Confirm that required items (for example, a wooden chest) are present in the inventory before attempting placement. The “No wooden_chest in inventory” error suggests an inventory check is needed prior to placement.

• Variable Definition Error
 – Verify that all variables are defined before use to prevent NameErrors. An undefined ‘target_chest’ indicates a possible typo or missing assignment—double-check variable names consistently.
